bow: how do you handle formal meals with toddler my in laws live rather formally they refuse to baby proof their home and have low glass tables covered in expensive handblown vases granite marble chess pieces at hands reach uncovered outlets four staircases without gates you get the idea yesterday they had lower oven less than foot from the floor on around 400 degree with one year old toddling around they just do care about preventing accidents but will yell and scream at kids and parents when they are over have year old daughter that have to bring into the situation clearly not going to change them so need to figure out how to manage this not only is the environment *dangerous* for children and the only play area an entire floor away they insist on having family dinners that are formal we re talking full china place settings floral arrangements crystal glassware and multi course meals we sat down for dinner at 6pm yesterday and had only gotten through *soup* by 6:45 needless to write it was disaster every holiday is an unmitigated hell because they refuse to accommodate children outside of an occasional sippy cup is anyone else in this situation what would you do do go to their house until your children are safe and accepted there you always have choice what would be tactful way to discuss this with them really agree with you but husband may not personally really tired of being set up for failure yes todlers arent formal can barly get my year old to sit for meal period if they choice to not acomidate the needs of your child its your choice to not go there its safty issue from what you discribed there are plenty of other options of places to see the grandparents until the children are developmentally ready to deal with house like you discribed if they have refused to accommodate children before would even try to discuss it with them if they invite you over just say no if they ask for reason you can say that the environment is safe for toddler and you do want you daughter to get hurt or for anything to be broken that sounds rough maybe try bringing your own toys or gadgets to entertain the gremlins have leappad that bring wherever need to distract the kids from certain destruction beside that would have your so have chat with his folks about how these dinners are not enjoyable for you having to helicopter parent the whole time deleted honestly would bother going over if they ca see that it not kid friendly environment then would say they do much care it already hard enough to wrangle year old outside of their typical enviornment but when the homeowners in this case grandparents are willing to make few concessions it near impossible would skip few dinners and see if they feel bad at all or if they are then willing to discuss it ve been in slightly similar but less strict situations and my solution at both locations was to bring my own portable http www amazon com evenflo soft wide gate dp b006pb2h40 ref=sr ie=utf8 amp qid=1393087509 amp sr=8 amp keywords=portable+baby+gate baby gate did let them know in advance brought it and asked once arrived to keep my child safe and my own travel http www amazon com brica travel booster black green dp b004l2jj6o ref=sr ie=utf8 amp qid=1393087242 amp sr=8 amp keywords=travel+high+chair high chair that is unobtrusive and will keep my little one where he needs to be during meal times also asked if could move very fragile items up to higher location while visited so the items would not be broken if the host balks at these very simple and temporary solutions they are not somebody you should be spending time with while your child is toddler and certainly someone that you should reconsider spending time with beyond that they clearly do not care about the wellbeing of your child and that is paramount in addition they seem not to want to adjust their lifestyle in any way shape or form to accommodate children so spending time with them in this environment is of little to no benefit to your kids either invite them out instead to child friendly events zoo aquarium park etc and see where they stand if they love you all and want to spend time with you but have hard time dealing with children in their own space these places should be safe zones it important to remember that children are sensitive at this age to emotion and these types of repetitive situations will leave an imprint on them my grandmother was very old fashioned and stiff when was growing up and it always made me feel like could play freely and be myself we were relegated to children table at every event even though there were just of us and told to be seen and not heard it will over time negatively effect the relationship they have with their grandparents in laws really appreciate all the work you put into these beautiful dinners and it so kind of you to invite us all over to share them unfortunately baby is at stage of development where she little whirlwind of destruction and worried she either going to hurt herself or break some of your beautiful things there are some steps we can take to try and mitigate the problem or we could just shift family get together to our child proofed house until baby big enough to be trusted at your house what do you think then if they wo budge just stop going over there but nicely definitely get your husband on board may offer different perspective not grandparent yet but do have older teenage children now my house is much different now than when had young children while would put crystal glasses in front of yr old would also not extensively baby proof my house for my grandkids back in the day nobody had baby proofed houses this is relatively new phenomenon to our generation and while think it is admirable to keep the kids safe older people tend to think lot of gadgets are necessary no judgement on either generation from me just trying to get you to see it from another viewpoint hear me out as grandparent you are old enough to have worked hard your whole life and as result have many nice things should they have to put everything away because you now have young children no they should should you have to have your toddler sit through hour formal dinner no you should would suggest shorter visits and maybe you can get an older cousin babysitter to watch your child while you can have nice sit down dinner with your in laws it sounds like it is important to your husband and would suggest letting this issue go as it sounds like you are going to change your in laws minds while they may not be cuddly grandparents your child can learn from an early age that not everyone house rules are the same hang in there my dear would have to tell the in laws that we will be rejoining them for holidays in about 15 years if they refuse to accommodate their grandchildren you as parent have to be the advocate for the kids its sad bc they raised kids too was it that long ago that they dont remember have had to refuse my inlaws holidays and visits they want to see the kids they come to us they live party lifestyle fancy meals friends over their house every night drinking partying till the wee hours they also have an inground pool they refused to fence off and then would get angry when refused to let my year old play in the yard while they drank with friends this sucked for long time husband was less then thrilled but again my kids my job to keep them safe good luck mama really hope you can find way around this do blame you it sounds like based of course on what limited information have about you that the discussion needs to be with your husband not your in laws your in laws have already proven to you that they are interested in having children at their house if they were they would make accommodations for them the next time you re invited over just tell them thanks but no thanks but would definitely have talk with your husband so he understands the situation before the next invitation comes if it were me though just snarky enough to let my kid break one of their vases so can have little told ya so moment is that totally rude or what lol have this problem also with all my family that does have kids and my grandmother as well do leave yourself at their mercy bring placemat dinner from home in case what is being served is not child friendly napkins wipes even though at home my son used regular cups bring spill proof cup as my grammas carpet is white in the dining room sit him down few minutes early and get him set up then when he is finished we excuse ourselves and set him up in another room with quiet activity return and finish my meal my son will return for desert we have established table manners at home and we expect them at family dinners except he is allowed to leave before everyone else is done but that just because cant expect him to sit for over an hour know my family appreciates this and always hear how well behaved he is and enjoy hearing it because know they would be honest with me think your son will be okay at three to be in non child proofed house my husband and will take turns watching our son while the other socializes until we are sure he will be okay ve also enlisted teenage cousins to watch him as did the same for them when they were little and have literally moved breakable valuables myself several times when my son was in the destructible toddler stages no one will mind since sometimes people who are around little kids just do think about it and the awkwardness of finding safe place for something is better then it getting broken agree that lot of those babyproofing gadgets are pretty unnecessary but do think that what she talking about she just does want them to leave the door to low oven hanging open when little ones are around and maybe put dangerous breakables on high shelf while there over do think that too much to ask if they really wanted their grandkids to come over they would do these simple things and not yell at the kids for acting like kids heh ca tell you the number of times ve wanted to just grab one of those vases and smash it *smash* still have done it this is pleasant thank you maybe can get husband on board think it is generational thing bit but it is fair on you or the children my grandparents are bit like this over time they have got better the oldest grandchild is 14 so took long time to get the idea and they often forget ornaments and put china cups of coffee on low tables and set out crystal ect latest thing is giveing year old china plate full of treats to offer round and acting surprised when everything ends up on the floor bring plates ect and just put anything dangerous out of reach we just have to be hypa vigilant as they have made some effort so guess all can say is try to find middle ground here the thing you are his wife she is his daughter he has to make decision whether he going to support you and protect her or cave to his parents if he chooses them it may be indicative of bigger problems in your relationship but for the moment let assume he on board and understands you two will need to present united front to his parents which may mean that you gracefully refuse all invitations to come over to their house until your daughter is older or they only come over to your house if that the case just make sure that they re greeted warmly and realize that they are still loved and respected members of your family it their house that the problem not them if your husband does insist that you guys go over to his parents house then you ve got couple of options at years old your daughter should be able to understand the idea that there are things she does not touch because they are not hers dangerous hot fragile etc you can sit down with her and explain that the pretty things at grandma amp grandpa house are only to look at not to touch if she knows where the play area is you can help her start to distinguish between what zones are free and what ones are as side note realized that instead of babyproofing the kitchen it would be far easier to kitchenproof the baby he been taught from very early on that he does not go into the kitchen without specific permission from mommy or daddy and he still stops with his toes short of the carpet wood flooring border when he little older ll start bringing him in to help me cook the second option is far more vindictive so it should really only be used with caution when you go over to your in laws house if your daughter breaks delicate crystal vase or throws chess piece through the window in the midst of tantrum do punish her for it let them see first hand what happens when they do take proper precautions to protect their fragile stuff from small hands and if they flip out just calmly tell them that you ve asked them repeatedly to move these things out of her reach so if they re not going to listen to you they can deal with the consequences husband brother and sil used to do guest appearances when their children were young they stop by for 30 minutes or so then one typically sil would take the kids home for dinner and bed did understand then but wondering if this is brilliant plan now good ideas thanks for sharing them you re so right about the negative influences she was mess last night because she kept getting in trouble and had nightmares all night long felt so bad for her and woke up this morning more committed than ever to finding solution we re also having second daughter in may so the problem about to double oh that great compromise too definitely bring that up as an option when you discuss it with your husband my parents baby proofed their house we go over there maybe few times month but then again my parents love the crap out of my kids and see the value of family over any possession just depends on the grandparent my in laws didnt baby proof granted my kids go there once ever months we normally just meet them at our house or we go out they equally love my kids just depend on the people appreciate your feedback and agree that generational issues are at play for instance there is the expectation that *i* as the woman will simply chase after our child the entire time we re there and my in laws would rather yell than prevent accidents it frustrating think there needs to be happy medium for instance let not put out boiling hot artichoke dip on low table that my toddler can reach yes this has happened let do family style meal when all the food is served at once so can actually *feed* my child then dismiss her from the table we run pretty tight ship at home she eats dinner and is required to sit with us for few minutes our meal times run about 20 30 minutes she then at three years asks may please be excused at that point we will dismiss her to wash her hands and play if there was safe space where she could entertain herself do that at my in laws but since they refuse to make even moderately safe space do have choice ^thank you this great suggestions thanks sadly though ve been screamed at by my husband family for moving breakable items crazy right you do go over there my inlaws have parrots parrots that are mean and territorial and who have more than once attacked my husband who grew up with other parrots and knows how to deflect protect from an attack he was bitten pretty badly my father in law refuses to put the birds in locked cage when bring my year old over he afraid of them do expect him to lock them in room but just close the cage door he wo their house their rules do have to take my kids over told my husband that was more than happy to take the kids over if the birds were put in cage but until then his parents can visit our house my husband told his mother the more reasonable one and she nags my father in law to do it usually we have to wait outside while he does begrudgingly thanks for your comments totally disagree the real issue here is their rigidity and grandparenting style nobody is asking them to put up corner protectors or locks on their cabinets they are being asked simply to move their fragile items to place of safety and not leave dangerous items accessible to the toddlers *they* are the invitees and should be willing to bend and it does seem like the type of invitation that is really an open offer when your mil sends standing invitation they are usually optional there is generational divide here many older folks think we should parent in the same strict fashion they and their parents did with little concern for the emotional wellbeing of our children in the past before psychology and behavioral sciences were respected and we were all worried about fostering emotional growth and milestones people parented in the way that was *easiest* for them without much thought to how those actions would shape their child into adulthood this is the seen and not heard mindset children should do as commanded and there is little if any understanding or acceptance of the activity and energy that children need to thrive these types of parents expect others to govern their children in the same manner and literally can not understand more gentle and child centric path to child rearing they believe that you are coddling your child if you make sure your house is childproofed which believe is setting them up for success spending their day in activities that are safe and encourage growth rather than an entire day of no and do well in my day we did blah blah blah and you turned out fine yes well in *your* day corporal punishment and denying children the right to opinions were normal occurrences certainly do think that acceptable if the situation is that stressful to your daughter do **not** put her in it again as parent and early childhood educator who performs sit down meals at work kids learn from exposure do not know the age of your child or the exposure you give them to certain things as parents we may take our children to applebee and other chain restaurants my children learned how to sit down at meals from home and our opportunities to go out and have sit down meal parents of my students very often year after year say wow ca believe that my three year old is drinking from an open cup serving themselves meals are brought to the table in bowls which students serve themselves using soup and spoon and cleaning their plate and place mat they just have to pour what left into garbage bucket place eating utensils in pile on tray and use paper towel cleaning spray to wipe down their mats many times as parents we underestimate our children ability to understand or learn new tasks in regards to the breakable items ve had my iphone broken by child taught who had developmental delay used apps to communicate and engage her through out the day when it broke said to her calmly and gently now we can not play with it because we did hold it tight and take care of it next time we used it she would let go even if she had an outburst that consisted of laying on the floor as far as exposure try taking your child to bed bath and beyond and do not keep them in carriage if they can walk there is no need for stroller it impedes their gross motor development and sense of initiative can go on but try exposing your little one slowly it maybe small lessons as seeing an electrical outlet at store that is uncovered and saying we do not touch this it burns and causes bad ouchie that sends you to the hospital this is glass when it breaks you can cut yourself like knife this also improves their language and communication skills wish you luck and if you do want to go to his parents it is ok but you ca impose your parenting style on them your husband most likely grew up in the same environment and they believe they do not need to make accommodations because of it thanks for your comments our daughter is three years old and we follow montessori method at home and she in montessori she drinks from glass uses silverware including knives helps us set the table etc we tidy up together and she will often help daddy make coffee or other breakfast foods we also bake with her not so much worried that she going to stick her finger in an outlet rather frustrated that they want to have hour long formal meal with courses in an environment littered with breakables for instance they have an expensive venetian sculpture that on an unsturdy and unsecured pedestal when you walk past it it shakes people have had to *catch* the bloody thing when kids have run past it ouch would say let her break it it is the grandparents turn to learn by exposure my mom always said you want nice things make sure you take care of them now she hides her make up and hair styling items away from the girls children are always most important than material items as for hour sit down meals for any child under the age of is too much hopefully this is issue is with all the grandchildren and once they see the decrease of visits of the small ones they will see the value of building relationship with the grandkids as opposed to their venetian vase good luck have an extremely energetic toddler who has to touch and grab *everything* what you just described sounds like **nightmare** would never go if not attending the dinners is not an option then this sounds like it might be great plan are you my sil in the same situation and my parents are the exact opposite parents are kind of country bumpkins here how do it let them see my child in all her glory my daughter had hummus all over her gorgeous 12 person dining table and few guests did apologize no have no reason to apologize for my daughter learning to eat with grown up fork which she also insisted stand your ground here with you that is so awful your daughter felt that way hope for your sanity and hers that you find solution before the next dinner be firm but with hint of compromise if they ve refused in the past they can proof smaller area section of room the whole house is alot of work for occasional guests or you do come because it safety issue note that the amount and accessibility of child proofed space available will impact the demeanor of the child and length of your stay you could also send husband over while you stay home not ideal but it compromise during this stage or find sitter and go once every other time as another compromise you do not have to bring your daughter into this situation you are choosing to and are doing yourself and your child disservice by your choices seriously you are the parents you make the calls choosing not to intentionally put your child in dangerous situation is generally considered good call if they ca be bothered to baby proof which is within their rights you ca be bothered to bring your child to them which is within your rights end of story no explanations needed why would you continue to go somewhere to see people who have been verbally abusive towards you ok for family dinners in general tell them this sure we love to come for dinner but daughter is really only capable for sitting politely for about half hour so if you want to do nice dinner then ll just get babysitter if you want us all there then maybe we could consider something little more casual for safety you just have to watch your kid unfortunately it would be nice if they baby proofed but ultimely the onus lies on you to make sure that your child is going into the kitchen with an open oven if you see an expensive item that is definitely in danger of being knocked over by your child or another person child just move the item pick it up and move it into another room just laugh it off with something like oh believe me saving you from lot of broken glass right now also going to your in laws might be really good time to be lax on the screen time rules ipads phones movie or two not going to kill them and will probably make the whole event less stressful for everyone well it would be tactful but you could knock stuff off their low tables and break it when the toddler is nearby and then blame him and say it best if he does come over until he little older if it were me though say to them and your husband that it not safe or fun for the toddler or the grandparents to have the toddler at their home so they re welcome to come visit at your home until he older and knows better how to be careful my mil has gone to any particular effort to baby proof her house but it still relatively baby *friendly* delicate objects are on shelves out of reach low cabinets are filled with age appropriate toys that kiddo can help herself to and she has things like high chair and pack play tucked into various hidden corners she picks up things like booster seats or baby swings from thrift stores it not like she totally rearranged her life or made it so her house is nice when there are kids there but she still accommodating to her grandkid so everyone can enjoy themselves when they re visiting perhaps it is worth explaining that there is too much risk of injury to your child amp their property and too much stress for you to enjoy yourself because of the lack of baby proofing and request as compromise that they allow you to proof one room you can keep bag of outlet covers doorknob covers etc at their house and set up and remove them with each visit get box and soft towels for the breakables you can not move out of reach if your child gets rambunctious at dinner excuse yourself and child and take turns with hubby unless you would rather just get away from them the only other alternative see is to opt out from time to time or hire sitter although it could serve as an opportunity to encourage your child to improve on the necessary behaviors for some big reward admittedly was too lazy to read all the posts so apologize if was repetitive in any ways food for thought fully prepared for the hail of potential downvotes but please give this wall of text sorry not sorry alternative perspective read the idea that any person regardless of relation much opportunities my two year old is aware that ovens in any state on off open closed are not to be touched why because he is around when cook even helps *it the social norm in my family he been taught cetain things his whole life now not suggesting you to throw toddler in the mix when you are cooking but there are words and worlds that are important to teach here mean the word hot this has had you mentioned earlier in the thread that you already do montessori with her whelp it up to your husband to train his parents think thanks for your comments speaking of montessori we had great moment tonight she gets glass of water in her room for bedtime when she needed more tonight she walked to the kitchen refilled the glass from the container in the fridge walked back to her room and then set everything right before she returned to her bed was so proud of her love the image of two year old in all her hummus glory stupid question is the wawaha the front or the back because ve never heard that phrase before it really fun to say this all of this yr old in playpen can not imagine this working out here are few thoughts to make your daughter feel more comfortable and ease the tension little pick up the sansbug pop up tent it has relatively small footprint is mesh so she can see if she wants to and it can be her safe spot play area while at grandparents or other unfamiliar places it is big enough for really big and tall man to stretch out in so big enough for three 6year olds to have teaparty we got ours on amazon and use it for our daughter toddler bed when we travel she sees it as her space equip it with yoga mat favorite blanket or two some plushies some books and some favorite toys and she ll be mostly set make it clear to your in laws that when your daughter is in the tent she is not to be spoken yelled at have bell that can be used by you or your husband to summon your daughter from her lair either pack dinner for your daughter so she can eat her meal and then escape or prepare her plate in the kitchen from all the courses if the in laws have staff ask the staff to do so just like you would ask to not have sauce or whatever if the concern is presentation like turkey to be carved at the table pieces can easily be taken off the underside make sure she eats substantial snack couple minutes before the formal meal especially if you were unable to do the all her food together prep my mum is similar she has baby proofed though we did take baby gate with us for visits when lo was small with no complaints but there are activities and toys at appropriate heights and my mum is good at redirecting attention away from vases and trinkets and back to toys being in child life is privilege and not right
